question: What's the difference between @State, @Binding, and @Environment in SwiftUI?
answer: @State owns data locally, @Binding shares data bidirectionally, @Environment provides app-wide values.
diagram:
flowchart TD
    A[Parent View] --> B[@State owns data]
    B --> C[@Binding shares data]
    C --> D[Child View modifies]
    D --> E[Parent updates]
    F[App/System] --> G[@Environment values]
    G --> H[All views access]
